metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0205 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The ssl3_get_cert_verify function in s3_srvr.c in OpenSSL 1.0.0 before 1.0.0p and 1.0.1 before 1.0.1k accepts client authentication with a Diffie-Hellman (DH) certificate without requiring a CertificateVerify message, which allows remote attackers to obtain access without knowledge of a private key via crafted TLS Handshake Protocol traffic to a server that recognizes a Certification Authority with DH support.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> precise isn't actually affected, as the code used to be wrong, resulting in a no-op, and having the same result as this security fix. See the following commit: https://git.openssl.org/gitweb/?p=openssl.git;a=commit;h=c2770c0e0e0da5f447227553c248f9a94504ee4e

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.8').
